name: St. Louise de Marillac

locations.description: Co-founded the Daughters of Charity in Paris

summary: Louise de Marillac was a French widow who, together with St. Vincent de Paul, co-founded the Daughters of Charity, the first non-cloistered religious community of women. She organized the community to serve the poor and sick in their homes, breaking with the tradition that religious women must be cloistered. She is the patron saint of social workers and is considered a pioneer in modern social work.
keyQuotes: Love the poor and honor them as you would honor Christ himself.
